segment.source: Fixing Applications by Using the SUA Tool (Windows 10)
segment.target: Fixing Applications by Using the SUA Tool (Windows 10)

segment.source: On the user interface for the Standard User Analyzer (SUA) tool, you can apply fixes to an application.
segment.target: On the user interface for the Standard User Analyzer (SUA) tool, you can apply fixes to an application.

segment.source: Fixing Applications by Using the SUA Tool
segment.target: Fixing Applications by Using the SUA Tool

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: On the user interface for the Standard User Analyzer (SUA) tool, you can apply fixes to an application.
segment.target: On the user interface for the Standard User Analyzer (SUA) tool, you can apply fixes to an application.

segment.source: To fix an application by using the SUA tool
segment.target: To fix an application by using the SUA tool

segment.source: Use the SUA tool to test an application.
segment.target: Use the SUA tool to test an application.

segment.source: For more information, see Using the SUA Tool.
segment.target: For more information, see Using the SUA Tool.

segment.source: After you finish testing, open the SUA tool.
segment.target: After you finish testing, open the SUA tool.

segment.source: On the Mitigation menu, click the command that corresponds to the action that you want to take.
segment.target: On the Mitigation menu, click the command that corresponds to the action that you want to take.

segment.source: The following table describes the commands.
segment.target: The following table describes the commands.

segment.source: Mitigation menu command
segment.target: Mitigation menu command

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Apply Mitigations
segment.target: Apply Mitigations

segment.source: Opens the Mitigate AppCompat Issues dialog box, in which you can select the fixes that you intend to apply to the application.
segment.target: Opens the Mitigate AppCompat Issues dialog box, in which you can select the fixes that you intend to apply to the application.

segment.source: Undo Mitigations
segment.target: Undo Mitigations

segment.source: Removes the application fixes that you just applied.
segment.target: Removes the application fixes that you just applied.

segment.source: This option is available only after you apply an application fix and before you close the SUA tool.
segment.target: This option is available only after you apply an application fix and before you close the SUA tool.

segment.source: Alternatively, you can manually remove application fixes by using Programs and Features in Control Panel.
segment.target: Alternatively, you can manually remove application fixes by using Programs and Features in Control Panel.

segment.source: Export Mitigations as Windows Installer file
segment.target: Export Mitigations as Windows Installer file

segment.source: Exports your application fixes as a Windows® Installer (.msi) file, which can then be deployed to other computers that are running the application.
segment.target: Exports your application fixes as a Windows® Installer (.msi) file, which can then be deployed to other computers that are running the application.
